data.text: In Europe, we will add several destinations to those 40 we have already announced, for example holiday charters to Greece. The flight schedule for August is currently being prepared. An update on this will follow soon. Click here for more info: https://t.co/46euQ1SkcW #ReadyToFly https://t.co/JCGFMF120x

From July onwards, we will take off to regular long-haul flights for the first time since mid-March. Bangkok, Chicago, New York and Washington will then be available with up to three weekly flights. The first long-haul aircraft will take off for New York at 10:15 a.m. on 1 July. https://t.co/GhLG9Pycm9

data.text: Wearing a mask in public transport has become standard in many countries worldwide. We too require our passengers to wear a mouth-nose covering on board. Additionally, there are several more protective measures helping to ensure safe travels in times of #COVID19. #ReadyToFly https://t.co/7HJ7viELfe

data.text: Happy #InternationalFlightAttendantDay! 🎉 A warm "Thank you" to all of our Aircraft Happiness Advocates, Airborne Ambassadors of Austria, Inflight Announcement Storytellers, Final Destination Connoisseurs and Aisle Traffic Controllers! ❤️✈️ See you soon onboard! #ReadyToFly https://t.co/JCBEBc7C9c
As we start our engines on 15 June again, we want all our passengers to feel safe on their journey. That's why we have prepared a comprehensive safety concept. #ReadyToFly https://t.co/FQCqv9MWi2
Yesterday we've announced our restart, today we've reached 100,000 followers. Good days! A big thank you to our great community! ❤️ https://t.co/dIbP2opbf9
As of 15 June it's time to say "Servus" again. 😊 Check out the flight schedule for the first two weeks of our restart. #ReadyToFly https://t.co/0E6aYYzsOO

data.text: As we are restarting our flight operations on 15 June you might ask yourself: How safe is flying in times of corona? How clean is an aircraft? And how do you protect yourself? Learn more about our hygiene & safety measures on our latest #AustrianBlog post: https://t.co/Td9cmMdhDr https://t.co/g7Js2pCyiV

It’s decided: On 15 June we will rise again! Check out this link for our June flight schedule and more news: https://t.co/46euQ1SkcW 

We can't wait to welcome you on board again! #WeAreAustrian #SeeYouSoon 😁 https://t.co/xoknKCKdk5

data.text: What's the difference between a point-to-point and a hub carrier? Why is the latter so important for a location? In short: You can offer more destinations as you're not dependent on local demand alone. The feeder network is also crucial for long-haul connections. #TuesdayThoughts https://t.co/D4MuywfxuC
#SeeYouSoon ✈️👋 https://t.co/P3fdyN0UVn
Picture ©: @Flugthier

data.text:
Can’t wait to fly again for you guys 
🛫 #SeeYouSoon #Servus #Boeing #B767 #LAE https://t.co/qNsBjXouUt

Austrian Airlines has also decided to extend the suspension of regular flight operations for another week, from 7 to 14 June. However, a restart in Mid-June has become more likely. Once we can confirm a restart date, we will publish a flight schedule for the first ramp up phase.

data.text: The restart plan envisages cost savings of 20 percent for suppliers, business partners and personnel. Austrian Airlines also plans to reduce its fleet from over 80 to 60 aircraft. Smaller (14 Dash 8, 7 A319) and older (3 Boeing 767) aircraft are to be phased-out.

Austrian Airlines COO @JensRitter_JR: "This agreement allows us to retain as many employees as possible in this crisis. We have taken a crucial step towards restarting flight operations. The employees are making a huge contribution to the crisis management of Austrian Airlines."

data.text: The savings plan includes the use of short-time work until 2022, a partly socially staggered salary reduction and the suspension of salary increases. From 2024 on, repayments are to be made to the employees, if the company is able to do so. The management will also forego salary.

Yesterday and this afternoon, an agreement with the representatives of the flight personnel as well as the commercial and technical personnel was reached. https://t.co/dg4JYAeNKG

data.text: RT @lufthansaNews: The air on board is completely changed every 3 minutes during cruise. Have you ever wondered how that is possible? Our s…

With a message from our CEO @AHoensbroech, we want to thank you, our community and all our passengers, for your patience and loyalty, even in a time when we are not flying at all. ❤️#WeAreAustrian #SeeYouInJune https://t.co/HodV0rMpUL
Picture ©: @austro_control

Die Krise der Luftfahrt hat vor der Luftraumüberwachung nicht halt gemacht. #Flightcast sprach mit @austro_control Geschäftsführerin @ValerieHackl über die Krise, #SingleEuropeanSky, Lotsenausbildung und die Zukunft der Luftraumüberwachung (German only): https://t.co/pqVtgFtMeD https://t.co/0oxXguDK8X

This is what a fully loaded "preighter" looks like from the inside. We have converted two B777 into passenger-cargo freighters increasing their load capacity by removing almost all seats. One of them, the OE-LPC, is currently returning from Shanghai with medical supplies. ✈️📦 https://t.co/f08hFW1fRB

A restart during the month of June is under review. https://t.co/Hu1sa1gzU2

data.text: Passenger aircraft as cargo aircraft? In times of COVID-19, this is no rarity! On the #AustrianBlog we will show you what a typical cargo transport in a passenger plane looks like, how the flights are planned and which precautions are necessary: https://t.co/kD3eqOpU2J 📦✈️ https://t.co/nw91G5gfcq
@Flugthier, we might have to start paying you for those nice pics 😅. Thank you very much once again.

entity.name: Sesame Street
entity.description: A longtime favorite of children and adults, and a staple of PBS, "Sesame Street" bridges many cultural and educational gaps with a fun program. Big Bird leads a cast of characters teaching children numbers, colors and the alphabet. Bert and Ernie, Oscar the Grouch and Grover are just a few of the other creatures involved in this show, set on a city street full of valuable learning opportunities.

RT @MFA_Austria: Medizinische Schutzbekleidung ist unabdingbar in Zeiten von #COVID19: Mit unserer Unterstützung landete heute der vorerst…

"Unlike some competitors, we want to avoid empty flights at all costs. We will only take off when a new start makes sense for Austrian Airlines and when the ease of travel restrictions makes this possible", says Austrian Airlines CCO Andreas Otto. https://t.co/kR8nEX3STX

Austrian Airlines can only envisage a slow resumption of regular flight operations in June at the earliest. Nevertheless, we intend to closely monitor the further development and will only resume flight operations when demand picks up again. https://t.co/wcpBBqmSr5

data.text: Currently we are operating daily cargo flights between China and Austria to collect urgently needed medical supplies helping against the coronavirus. We are now removing 270 of 306 seats from two of our Boeing 777 (OE-LPA & OE-LPC) increasing the respective cargo capacity by 35%. https://t.co/Yrw4zW5ciQ

data.text: Wow, you guys are fast as Sherlock! 🕵️‍♂️ It truly is our Boeing 777 OE-LPA (Sound of Music). As a reward, you get another picture of this beauty! Guess, we‘ll have to come up with something more challenging next time ... 😅 https://t.co/NQ47tQOlqU
Little riddle: What type of plane from our fleet has a belly like this? You'll receive a bonus point if you can correctly guess the registration as well. 😉 #MondayThoughts https://t.co/Jzg5NPvLsc

Last but not least: The domestic aviation industry plays a crucial role in international trading and thus for Austria's export-oriented economy: 50% of the value of domestic exports are transported by air freight. #WeAreAustrian #WeAreInThisTogether 🛫 https://t.co/bAjkuu90fT

data.text: Besides supporting 95,000 jobs, Austrian Airlines is playing an important role in Austria’s general economic performance. Being the only domestic provider of long-haul flights with 130 destinations worldwide, we are a main pillar in aviation’s contribution of 8 bn € to the GDP. https://t.co/1QwZQwdu4d

Most of our fleet is currently grounded. But are planes parked just like cars? What precautions need to be taken? Our Chief Operating Officer Jens Ritter gives answers in the newest AustrianBlog - quite some interesting reading material for the weekend!😉

https://t.co/Sat3XxUa8W https://t.co/XXBoJfZQoF
Thx for the pic, @Flugthier!

data.text: We will do whatever is necessary to secure the future of Austrian Airlines despite corona. Why? We are by far the largest airline in Austria, the only domestic long-haul flight provider and thus contribute in supporting 95,000 jobs – in aviation, tourism, retail and gastronomy. https://t.co/GH62zRSX91

Masks, gloves and suits: Since the end of March we have flown more than 600 tons of medical supplies from China and Malaysia to Austria. 🛫📦 We will continue this special airlift for the next few weeks and are proud to support in this situation!

#TeamÖsterreich #WeAreAustrian https://t.co/i1ciXzn90f

Our wonderful crew has taken on the #DontRushChallenge. We can't wait to take off with you again! 🛫 Click here to see the full version: https://t.co/p1kUJo6Rif

#WeAreAustrian #NoGoodbyeSeeYouLater https://t.co/cN24B7koxC

"We will part with the oldest and smallest aircraft," explains CCO Andreas Otto. After sentence: "also for ecological reasons." Despite the reduction of the fleet, as many jobs as possible are to be maintained. Appropriate talks are already underway with the works councils. https://t.co/qPxTpkmX5e

The restart plan envisages a fleet of around 60 aircraft in 2022, nine of which will be long-haul aircraft. The adaptation of the fleet is to take place in stages. Since mainly smaller aircraft are being decommissioned, this corresponds to a capacity reduction of around 20%. https://t.co/bfFeNHrOpM

In order to adjust capacity to the changed demand from corona, Austrian Airlines has decided to make fleet changes. In addition to the phase-out of the 18 Dash turboprops, which was decided and started in 2019, all seven A319 and three of the six B767s are to be retired by 2022. https://t.co/aOl7SXEJuA

CEO @AHoensbroech: "The model of short-time work helps us to fly through this crisis as well as possible. Our goal remains unchanged: As soon as possible, we want to start flying again. Even if it will be a long way to a new normality, we are preparing for it with full force." https://t.co/Vxw8rBp7VL

The Austrian Airlines employees have been on short-time work since 20 March, initially for one month. This had become necessary after worldwide entry bans and a sharp decline in demand due to the coronavirus forced Austrian to suspend flight operations temporarily on 18 March. https://t.co/ZHrJV15LKa

Due to the global developments in connection with the coronavirus and the continuing restrictions on travel, Austrian Airlines is extending the short-time work model for its 7,000 employees by a further month until 19 May 2020. https://t.co/68znc0V9zX
RT @li_xiaosi: Honored to hand over the medical materials donated by the Chinese government to the Austrian government today. "Only togethe…
RT @MFA_Austria: In Zusammenarbeit mit dem Außenministerium landete heute bereits der 4. Beschaffungsflug aus Penang 🇲🇾 in Wien. An Bord de…

data.text: We have now established daily flights between Austria and China to import important medical protective clothing for Austria. Yesterday, the Chinese government sent us a cargo package in the joint fight against the spread of the #Coronavirus - and a message. 🇨🇳🛫🛬🇦🇹 https://t.co/yQNLXcwlgI
Long-haul planes will take off from Vienna to Asia every day to collect further supplies. "The airlift is well established", Andreas Otto adds. https://t.co/L5f68XnZCD

data.text:
Special flights will continue to be operated. Two long-haul planes from China will land this afternoon in Vienna with urgently needed medical protective clothing. Over 400 tons of relief supplies have been flown in from China & Malaysia up until now. 

Picture: Clemens Schleinzer https://t.co/Wwl0tpdypg

The precise time when regular flight operations will be resumed depends on the easing of travel restrictions and the related increase in demand. “In any case, we continue to stand ready to initiate a slow restart”, says Austrian Airlines CCO Andreas Otto. https://t.co/jWMKHjYNiZ

Worldwide entry bans imposed as a consequence of the coronavirus continue to be in force. For this reason, Austrian Airlines has to prolong the cessation of its regular scheduled flight operations once again for an additional two weeks from 3 May to 17 May 2020. https://t.co/7DJnDgfLzd
Foto: @t_gru

Weltweit sind Flugzeuge eher „Stehzeuge“. Denn sie parken coronabedingt auf den Vorfeldern der Flughäfen. #Flightcast hat dazu mit @JensRitter_JR gesprochen, der erläutert, wie die Stehzeuge gewartet werden müssen. Er ist COO bei uns. https://t.co/sXATq9x84x​ (German Podcast) https://t.co/5LuJLIDr6k

Our New Zealand repatriation flight was completed a few days ago, but we couldn't help sharing this great video from @CHC_Airport with you, which we just received. That takeoff at the end ... 😍 https://t.co/oIei6ahK3s

data.text:
About 45 hours of flight & taxi time. A distance flown, almost as long as the circumference of the earth - you can be proud guys!

Fun Fact: The 🇳🇿 flag was a gift of @CHC_Airport. It used to hang on the mast of the airport fire department. Thank you!🙏😊

Picture: Michael Gruber https://t.co/PG2aB4xQP1

The biggest repatriation operation in Austria's history is coming to an end. We especially want to thank @mfa_austria for their trust and the excellent cooperation. And huge thanks to our great team, the crews and organizers who made these flights possible! #WeAreAustrian 🇦🇹 ✈️ https://t.co/iXn239zXq2
RT @MFA_Austria: Herzlichen Dank an alle Beteiligten, insbesondere an all unsere Kolleginnen & Kollegen im Außenministerium & an den Vertre…

Spirit of Austria, OE-LPD, has just landed safely at @flughafen_wien with about 300 repatriated Austrians and Europeans from @AKL_Airport @CHC_Airport #NewZealand via #kualalumpur #CoronaVirusUpdate https://t.co/53fBEewWDq

data.text:
Something new to see in New Zealand! 😉📸

Thanks @CHC_Airport for these great family pictures! @lufthansaNews https://t.co/ed9i9PyZ21

"Our goal remains to maintain as many flight connections and as many jobs as possible", says @AHoensbroech. Austrian Airlines intends to continue operating the Vienna hub with its short, medium and long-haul routes: "We will do whatever is necessary to achieve this goal.”

This realignment includes a reduction in the size of the fleet and consistent restructuring. The extent to which this will take place has not yet been finally defined and also depends on the further development of the crisis.

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

data.text: "The world we will be flying into will be a different one. People will travel again, but the economy, tourism and passenger needs will have changed after the Corona crisis. We will align our company to master this challenge”, says Austrian Airlines CEO @AHoensbroech.

Austrian also anticipates a significant reduction in demand for 2021 and the "pre-corona level" will probably not be reached until 2023 at the earliest. Accordingly, the red-white-red airline is preparing for a reorientation and adaptation to the changed travel behavior.

data.text: The Austrian Federal Government announced yesterday that, due to the coronavirus, complete freedom to travel cannot be expected to come back soon. Austrian Airlines currently assumes that it will have 25-50% of the demand in summer 2020 compared to 2019. https://t.co/8tj5PvoeFw

Halfway on our repatriation trip to the other side of the world, the Austrian eagle has landed for its break in Kuala Lumpur. Tomorrow we are off to New Zealand - the farthest a plane in red-white-red has ever been from home. ✈️🌏 https://t.co/6dJV7QYq1f

urls.description: In the last few weeks, due to the increase of COVID-19 cases, unique and unusual repatriation flights have been carried out all over the world. Aviation is i...

Photos by Michael Gruber @MFA_Austria

data.text: Yesterday our Sibanye ("We are one") brought 184 Europeans home from Nigeria, 70 of them German neighbours and 30 Austrians.  Only united we can master the crisis! #Coronakrise 🇦🇹🇪🇺 @EPinOesterreich @D_Botschafter @lufthansaNews @bkagvat @MFA_Austria https://t.co/UrOLa1o0AT

So far, over 6,000 people returned home aboard our flights from all over the world on behalf of @mfa_austria. We plan to operate further repatriations in the coming days, including a new record-setting flight to New Zealand via Kuala Lumpur! #TeamÖsterreich #WeAreAustrian 🇦🇹 ✈ https://t.co/0h9VYk2xJW

Our repatriation flight crew in front of the Sibanye, the latest addition to our B777 fleet. They are expected to land in Abuja in about 4 hours. Have a safe trip! 

Picture: Michael Gruber / @MFA_Austria https://t.co/T29yEsSf2k

data.text:
Sibanye means „we are one“ in Xhosa. Sibanye is also the name of our Boeing777 aircraft which just took off to bring home Austrians and Germans from #Nigeria on behalf of @MFA_Austria. #Corona @lufthansaNews #WeAreInThisTogether 
@flightradar24: https://t.co/fkYspPwzqz https://t.co/xCQtxKuvyR

How do you plan and operate a repatriation flight? And what are the biggest challenges? On this week's special #AustrianBlog our pilot Reinhard Lernbeiss reveals insights on these exceptional flights from his personal experience! https://t.co/xIHtX1WtZx ✈️👨🏻‍✈️ https://t.co/n5zToNZz0K

In the past weeks we brought home more than 6,000 stranded people on behalf of @MFA_Austria. This has been complemented by 180 tons of medical masks, suits and gloves transported to Vienna from China and Malaysia.
“We continue to stand ready for a new and slow relaunch. It goes without saying that we will continue to carry out our repatriation and freight flights for medical supplies”, says our CCO.

data.text: The launch of flight service to Boston planned for June will be delayed due to travel restrictions. “The precise time when regular flight operations are resumed, remains to be seen and depends more on the underlying conditions than on us”, says Austrian Airlines CCO Andreas Otto.

The worldwide entry bans imposed as a consequence of the coronavirus are expected to continue or will even be expanded. For this reason, Austrian Airlines will also prolong the cessation of its regular scheduled flight operations by another two weeks, from 19 April to 3 May 2020. https://t.co/UsbpSEiQJy

data.text: Yesterday another exceptional repatriation charter landed in Vienna: a triangular flight to Santiago (sunny), Buenos Aires (cloudy) and back to Vienna (sunny again). The last leg from EZE to VIE alone took 13 hours. Watch the playback here: https://t.co/gOxokiyRfX @flightradar24 https://t.co/YO4kMeNQNp
RT @MFA_Austria: Nach 23h Flugzeit & einem kurzen Tankstopp in Penang 🇲🇾 landeten heute Nacht 295 Passagiere aus Down Under in Wien. Vielen…
Our colleagues created this collage on their own and sent it to us. It's our pleasure to share it with you! 😊 #NoGoodByeSeeYouLater #WeAreAustrian 🇦🇹✈️ https://t.co/9nA1NXaL4v
.... Gloveliner has landed safely in Vienna 😊 🇦🇹 https://t.co/45a5RNHLFS

data.text: After its historic nonstop flight to Sydney, the "Spirit of Austria" is on the way back to Vienna. On board: 300 passengers and millions of medical gloves, which we picked up during refueling in Penang. Follow the Austr(al)ian Gloveliner 😉 @flightradar24: https://t.co/coQho0tUwY https://t.co/u6kfpVValn
RT @BitaRasoulian: The Austrian Embassy MNL and Austrian Airlines @_austrian repatriated 200 stranded Austrians and non-Austrians safely ba…
RT @MFA_Austria: Bereits in den frühen Morgenstunden landeten 287 Passagiere, die auf den Philippinen & in Vietnam gestrandet waren, in Wie…

data.text: Several special flights are in the air right now: Two Boeing 777 coming out of Xiamen are bringing more medical supplies. They are expected to land in Vienna at around 4 p.m. A third B777 is on the way to Santiago de Chile for another repatriation flight. #TeamÖsterreich ✈️🇦🇹 https://t.co/ltDcpyCfvJ
For those who get confused here, you may use the most practical (but also corniest) rule of thumb known to mankind in this case: No kangaroos in Austria! 🇦🇹😉😁

Austria meets Australia! 😎🇦🇹🇦🇺

Pictures: @SydneyAirport / Kurt Ams https://t.co/DLCjxOAWVH

data.text: The "Spirit of Austria" has landed safely in Sydney after almost 18 hours of flight time. Truly a historic moment for us. Again huge thanks to our fantastic employees for this remarkable achievement! 🙏✈️🇦🇹 #WeAreAustrian https://t.co/UCKyua9gW1
